translations.title: Privacy policy
translations.content:
DATA SECURITY

HTTPS SECURE BROWSING

Your navigation on the application is secure and encrypted by the HTTPS protocol. Your activity is thus protected throughout your use of the application and the exchanges with the server which could be intercepted for fraudulent use cannot be decrypted and interpreted.

AUTHENTICATION INFORMATION

The UnivLorraine application, in its native version (Android and Apple), offers you to save your password. This password is stored encrypted in a database and the encryption key allowing the use of this password is shared between the client and the server so your authentication cannot be used by anything other than the application installed on your device.

If your device is lost or stolen, it is imperative to change your password from your sesame https://sesame.univ-lorraine.fr/index and notify your IT department.

THE DATA WE COLLECT AND THE REASONS FOR THIS COLLECTION

The UnivLorraine application collects information about your access to the various services it offers (date and time, frequency, IP address). This collection only serves us exclusively to establish statistics of use of the application in order to offer services more adapted to your habits and your needs.

These statistics are anonymized and are only accessible to staff of the Digital Department of the University of Lorraine. No data is shared with other third-party services or companies.

The application does not collect any other data (location, contacts, etc.).

DEVICE FEATURES

The UnivLorraine application accesses a number of services offered by your browsers and devices. It necessarily asks you for permissions for this:

  • either globally at the time of installation
  • or when using the service for the necessary authorizations.

The app never uses any function of your device or browser without your consent. Moreover, the native iOS and Android applications could not be published on the stores if they did not request these authorizations. Finally, no information is shared with other third-party services or companies.

INFORMATION ABOUT YOUR CONNECTION

The UnivLorraine application requires knowing the status of your connection (wifi/3G/offline) in order to offer you the appropriate services. It therefore asks you for permission to access this information, which is neither collected nor stored.

INFORMATION ABOUT YOUR DEVICE

The UnivLorraine application requires knowing your type of hardware, OS, system version in order to establish equipment statistics and offer suitable services. It therefore asks you for permission to access this information, which is collected for statistical purposes only (see paragraph).

INFORMATION ABOUT YOUR GEOGRAPHICAL POSITION

The UnivLorraine application offers a geolocation service for all of the establishment's sites. In addition to offering the coordinates of each entity, it offers you the possibility of geolocating yourself in relation to them for a possible route calculation.

In addition, the UnivLorraine application informs you of the menus in the various university restaurants. To give you the best experience, the app ranks these restaurants in order of proximity to your location.

For these services, the application requires and asks you for permission to know your geographical position. This information is neither collected nor stored.

ACCESS TO YOUR CONTACTS

The UnivLorraine application offers a Directory service that allows you to search for the contact details of any staff or student of the establishment. It then offers you the possibility of saving the contact found directly in your address book.

To do this, the application asks you for permission to access your address book (your contacts). It does not read or share your existing contacts.

STORAGE ACCESS

In general, the UnivLorraine application keeps a certain amount of information loaded (in cache) in order to avoid having to reload it later. This improves performance to give you better usability and an optimal experience.

For this, the application uses the storage of your browser or asks you for permission to access the storage of your device. The storage spaces are partitioned and the application cannot access data stored by other applications.

ACCESSING YOUR CAMERA

The UnivLorraine application offers a workspace reservation service accessible, among other things, through a QRCode displayed at the entrance to the rooms.

To scan the QRCode, the application uses the camera then a QRCode reading library to determine the corresponding room in order to launch the search.

That's why the app asks you for permission to use your device's camera.

translations.title: A propos
translations.content:
L'application UnivLorraine a été réalisée grâce à l'outil Esup-Multi, un projet open source soutenu par le consortium Esup-portail.

Initié par l'Université de Lorraine, en collaboration avec d'autres établissements, ce projet vise à répondre aux besoins spécifiques de la communauté universitaire, tout en offrant une solution adaptable et personnalisable pour chaque établissement.

Multi, financé en partie par le plan France Relance dans le cadre de l'appel à projets Services Numériques aux Étudiants offre une architecture modulaire permettant une personnalisation approfondie, garantissant ainsi que l'application Esup-Multi puisse s'interconnecter au système d'information de l'établissement.

translations.title: About
translations.content:
The UnivLorraine application was developed using Esup-Multi, an open source project supported by the Esup-portail consortium.

Initiated by the Université de Lorraine, in collaboration with other institutions, this project aims to meet the specific needs of the university community, while offering a solution that can be adapted and customised for each institution.

Multi, part-funded by the France Relance plan as part of the call for Services Numériques aux Étudiants projects, offers a modular architecture enabling extensive customisation, ensuring that the Esup-Multi application can interconnect with the institution's information system.
